headline: Man United transfer news LIVE - Andre Onana exit, done deal, Malick Fofana stance
body: While the summer transfer window has slammed shut in England, several Manchester United players look set to depart as trading periods in Saudi Arabia and Turkiye are still open.

Ruben Amorim was able to sanction a number of exits for fringe players and outcasts on deadline but some still remain. Tyrell Malacia saw his loan switch to Elche collapse but a temporary move to Eyupspor is said to have been agreed

As for Andre Onana, he seemingly became third-choice goalkeeper after the late summer arrival of Senne Lammens. A move to Trabzonspor is now in the works but his current focus has been on Cameroon with a blow to his confidence potentially coming in their defeat to Cape Verde.
Potential incomings down the line have also remained with a long-term plan in place for Brighton's Carlos Baleba after United were unable to get a deal done this summer.
Follow all the United transfer news updates throughout the day below...
That is all for the United blog this Wednesday.
Thank you for joining us! The team shall be back with you tomorrow bringing all the latest United news as and when we get it.
But for now, good night!
Eriksen has completed his transfer to Bundesliga club Wolfsburg after leaving United on a free.
After his arrival was confirmed, the Dane said:

VfL Wolfsburg is my first club in the Bundesliga – I’m really looking forward to this new adventure. I’m convinced we can achieve something together at Wolfsburg. The talks with the club bosses went very well. I immediately sensed that Paul Simonis has a clear vision for the team and for me personally. The fact that there are several familiar faces in the squad from the Danish national team makes VfL a particularly attractive proposition for me.
Despite missing out on a move during the regular summer transfer window, it appears that Tyrell Malacia is set to leave the Reds before the end of the international break.
Turkish journalist Resat Can Ozbudak reports that United have reached an agreement with Eyupspor to loan Malacia to them for the season.
The Dutchman is the final member of the 'bomb squad' to not sign for a new club yet.
According to EFL Analysis, United are ready to battle the likes of Borussia Dortmund and Spurs for Cardiff City centre-back Dylan Lawlor.
The 19-year-old has been a regular feature for the Bluebirds this term and has turned the heads of European football's top clubs already.
United are believed to have joined Chelsea, Spurs and Newcastle on a scouting mission already this season.
Foot Mercato understands that United tried their luck to sign Lyon winger Malick Fofana in the final stages of the transfer window after Alejandro Garnacho left for Chelsea.
It is believed that the Reds contacted Fofana's team about the possibility of speaking to the 20-year-old but they did not receive the green light to approach him.
Everton, Nottingham Forest, Liverpool and Chelsea were also thought to be interested in the forward.
After being released at the end of last season, it appears that Christian Eriksen could be about to sign for a new club.
German journalist Florian Plettenberg is reporting that Eriksen is on the verge of joining Bundesliga club Wolfsburg.
Eriksen has been training with Swedish club Malmo recently.

According to The Athletic, Onana was informed by United after deadline day that he would be welcome to stay at Old Trafford but, if he so wanted to, he could explore options in Turkey and Saudi Arabia.
It is believed that while it will just be a straight loan to Trabzonspor for this season, Onana is effectively ending his career at Old Trafford by leaving.
Onana is thought to be aware of this and is hopeful that a good season in Turkey could rebuild his reputation.
Hello and welcome back to the United blog.
My name is Jack Flintham and I shall be taking you through the next few hours of United news and when we get it.
Take a look at some of the day's biggest news stories from the MEN below:
Barcelona attacking midfielder Dro Fernandez is reportedly wanted by United and Liverpool.

The 17-year-old, who can play as a central attacking midifelder and left winger, is said to be attracting interest from England. Fichajes have claimed the pair have the teenager on their radar with Manchester City and Chelsea also mentioned.
United are one of the clubs tracking Cardiff City defender Dylan Lawlor, according to reports.

The 19-year-old has started all six matches this season and EFL Analysis have claimed that the Reds are joined by Tottenham, Chelsea and Newcastle are all keen alongside Borussia Dortmund and RB Leipzig.
Bryan Mbeumo faces the prospect of featuring in must-win World Cup play-offs this autumn as Cameroon appear increasingly unlikely to win their group and qualify automatically.

The Indomitable Lions were unbeaten across their first seven match, but have now lost their eighth to Cape Verde. Cameroon must finish as one of the four best-ranked runners-up who advance to the second round.

They are currently fifth on goal difference, but just one point separates second and seventh. Doing so would see them through to a four-team play-off consisting of a semi-final and potentially a final in November.
Real Betis CEO Ramón Alarcón has told ABC Sevilla it took help from shirt provider Hummel to get a deal over the line for Manchester United winger Antony.

"We had a difference of €5-6m and had already reached our limit. In the end, we all made an effort, we did our part, and so did the player and United," he said. "On Sunday, during the match against Athletic, the relationship was very tense. Around noon, United sent the draft contract and asked us to make the changes. It was clear that they were going to comply with our requests.

"In the early hours of Sunday morning, at 2:00 a.m., we received confirmation. In the morning, we closed the accounting for Antony’s future capital gains because we wanted to have the ability to recover the investment. It was one of the most problematic points, but we resolved it.

"Sunday at 2:00 a.m. is when the situation was unblocked, and we started looking for a plane so he could come on Monday afternoon. There was still a bit of stress because everything was agreed upon, but we had to wait for the Manchester United owners in the United States to sign, and they did so at 3:00 p.m. on Monday.

"We’ve launched a clothing line with Antony, we’re participating with him through royalties, and he’ll also have some non-sporting income from that merchandising. If he ends up being the world star he has been, we at Betis hope to recover the investment and even what it cost us the previous year. It carries a certain risk because this is locked in for five years and at a high cost, but you can potentially reap benefits.
"It’s the most difficult signing I’ve made as CEO because there was a lot of pressure from all the Betis fans. It was taken for granted that he was coming; everyone was asking when he was coming."
61 Saat claims that Andre Onana will fly to Turkiye for his medical tomorrow ahead of a loan move to Trabzonspor.
The Cameroonian international will reportedly be on the pitch for the clash with Fenerbahçe on Sunday.
Journalist Hasan Tüncel adds that a 'special plane' is being chartered for the United goalkeeper with his arrival at Trabzonspor expected shortly.
Football Insider claims Manchester United 'are desperate' to sign a defensive midfielder in the January transfer window.
The report adds that Ruben Amorim's side won't be able to sign Carlos Baleba in the winter window given Brighton's £100m asking price.
Although the report does not name a 'top target' it cites central midfield as the key position that United will look to add to their ranks in January.
Senne Lammens arrived at Manchester United on deadline day from Royal Antwerp.
The young goalkeeper was signed in an £18million deal and could even start against Manchester City this weekend.
With Andre Onana set to join Trabzonspor and Altay Bayindir struggling to make the position his to lose, Lammens could be handed his debut at Etihad Stadium.
The chances of that may have just increased with the Athletic revealing he took part in his first training session on Monday. A full week at Carrington may see him be ready from the off.
Andre Onana could have remained in the Premier League even if he did leave Manchester United.

A fresh report from talkSPORT now claims that before the end of the summer transfer window in the UK, West Ham United were given the chance to sign Onana on a loan deal from United. It was a move that the outlet claims was ‘actively considered’ by the Hammers’ hierarchy.

However, Onana’s performance against Grimsby, where two of his errors in goal led to both Grimsby goals, raised concerns over a potential move. West Ham chairman David Sullivan then pulled the plug on the deal, the report adds.
Manchester United do not look set to give up on signing Carlos Baleba despite being priced out of a move by Brighton this past summer.
Transfer guru Fabrizio Romano, via the Here We Go Podcast, has revealed what he will be their plan for Baleba.
Manchester United will continue with the opportunity to go for Carlos Baleba from Brighton. It was a completely closed door this summer. Let's see what's going to happen in the future.

I think Manchester United will try again for Baleba in 2026. Intensity in midfield is what Ruben Amorim keeps repeating in every meeting they have at Manchester United. I think they will go for that kind of player, with Baleba as a top target in 2026.
Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana appears to be lacking in confidence and that was perhaps further showcased on international duty with Cameroon.

Ahead of his imminent transfer to Trabzonspor in Turkiye, Onana started his nations 1-0 World Cup qualification defeat to Cape Verde. The goal they conceded came after some rather calamitous defending but Onana certainly did not help himself.

As Dailon Rocha Livramento bore down on goal after escaping several challenges, Onana was seemingly caught in two minds. Ultimately, he opted to stay on his line which allowed the striker to break into the box and pick his spot with relative ease.
Following that defeat, Cameroon are at risk of not qualifying for the World Cup with Libya just one point behind them in the standings.
Tyrell Malacia finally looks set to seal a Manchester United exit after seeing his loan to Elche called off on deadline day.
The Dutch left-back is the final member of United's 'Bomb squad' with Jadon Sancho, Antony and Marcus Rashford all being moved on. But he is now also seemingly about to join a new club.
According to Turkish journalist Resat Can Ozbudak, Eyupspor have reached an agreement with United for the temporary transfer of Malacia.
Hello and welcome back to our Manchester United transfer live blog!

Even though the window has been shut for over one week, there is still plenty of transfer news on the agenda. It mostly surrounds exits with Tyrell Malacia and Andre Onana both looking set for moves to Turkiye.
United continue to be linked to midfielders with Brighton's Carlos Baleba at the very top of their wishlist.
For all the latest United transfer news and rumours, stay right here!
Andre Onana will fly to Turkey to complete his move to Trabzonspor on Thursday, according to reports.
The Daily Mail report that the goalkeeper will complete the formalities of his move after returning from international duty.
The player was in action for Cameroon on Tuesday night, but couldn't prevent his side falling to a 1-0 loss.

Manchester United goalkeeper Andre Onana is closing in on a move to Turkish side Trabzonspor, but he did have the chance to move to another Premier League side in the final days of the window, according to latest reports.

The arrival of deadline day signing Senne Lammens from Royal Antwerp has seen Onana fall down the pecking order at Old Trafford this season. Altay Bayindir has been preferred to him in the Premier League so far, with his only appearance coming in the penalty shootout loss against League Two Grimsby Town in the Carabao Cup.

While the transfer window may now be closed in England, the window remains open in Turkey meaning that players can still complete moves to clubs in the league. A loan move to Trabzonspor now looks to be on the cards for Onana.
READ MORE HERE
Brazil manager Carlo Ancelotti has said that it's 'impossible' to replace Casemiro, amid talk of the midfielder leaving United next summer.
Brazil are in action against Bolivia this week, but will be without Casemiro through suspension.
Speaking ahead of the game, Ancelotti said:
"Looking for a midfielder with Casemiro’s characteristics is impossible. There’s no other Brazilian player who has the same characteristics as Casemiro."
Manchester United face new competition for Crystal Palace midfielder Adam Wharton, according to latest reports.
United have been credited with an interest in the player for some time, but TEAMtalk now claim that Newcastle United, Liverpool and Chelsea have joined the race for Wharton.
Palace are said to be aware of the growing interest in the midfielder but are hoping for a sale next summer instead of in the January window.
Hello United fans,
Amie here and I will be with you throughout this evening bringing you all of the latest Manchester United news.
First, here's a look at some of the things you may have missed from so far today:
Alejandro Garnacho makes Bruno Fernandes feelings clear in 10-word message after Man United exit
It's been tough' - Bryan Mbeumo opens up about his start at Manchester United
Three transfers Man Utd could still complete in the next three days as major Onana boost emerges
Sir Jim Ratcliffe oversees major Ineos decision amid Sheikh Jassim Man United takeover stance
Brazilian sides Flamengo and Palmeiras are both keeping tabs on Casemiro amid continued uncertainty over his future at Manchester United.
The 33-year-old is in the final year of his contract and is likely to leave the club. According to journalist Jorge Nicola, the Brazilian isn't expected to depart until his deal expires.
Both Flamengo and Palmeiras are keen with Sao Paulo also interested.
Bryan Mbeumo is enjoying life at Manchester United but believes his start at the club has been "tough."

"It's been tough," Mbeumo told club media. "I was expecting a lot from here because it's a big club. It's a big everything. I'm really happy with what happened to me here, the teammates, the staff, everyone in Carrington are lovely people.
"You really want to come in and work here every day, which is really good. When I first arrive somewhere, I don't really know, I don't like to be loud or show myself a lot [be outgoing]."
Arsenal are reportedly in a strong position to beat Man United transfer target Angelo Stiller.
Caught Offside have reported that United aren't giving up on the midfielder after exploring the possibility of activating his £27.8m release clause. However, the Gunners are now considering a move.
Nottingham Forest have moved swiftly to replace Nuno Espirito Santo with Ange Posteoglou taking charge.
The former Tottenham man will take charge on Saturday's clash with Arsenal. United travel to Forest at the start of November.
Man United will try and sign Stuttgart midfielder Angelo Stiller once again in January after failing with a late move in the summer.
Caught Offside have claimed that United tried to bringing him in before the window closed. Stiller has a £32m release clause in his contract.

headline: RAILSTON: What Andre Onana did on his Manchester United debut warned he would fail
body: Andre Onana furiously ranted at Harry Maguire when a slack pass from the defender gifted Borussia Dortmund a chance during Manchester United's final pre-season friendly in the USA in 2023.
Maguire kept his cool while he was berated. Some fans said the reaction was unnecessary in a friendly, while other supporters were pleased to see Onana quickly lay down the law.
Just weeks later, Onana was fortunate not to chuck away three points against Wolves on his debut when he crashed into Sasa Kalajdzic in the box and failed to make contact with the ball.
Wolves were denied a blatant penalty and the PGMOL apologised to a dumbfounded Gary O'Neil.
Onana got away with the huge error on his debut, but the episode foreshadowed his topsy-turvy stint at Old Trafford, which has culminated in Trabzonspor being on the cusp of signing him on loan.
Onana signed from Inter Milan in a deal worth £47million and was expected to be a transformative signing. In reality, he has struggled to back up his vociferous nature with substance.

The Cameroon international's performances in the Champions League group stage in his first season were error-strewn. And the first mistake Onana made came during a narrow defeat to Bayern Munich in September 2023, allowing Leroy Sane's tame shot to trickle through his fingertips.

Onana requested to speak to the media following the final whistle, saying: "I'm the one who let the team down. The team were good, but because of me, we didn't win this game, so we just have to move on. This is the life of a goalkeeper and if we didn't win today, it's on me."
United fans respected Onana for taking responsibility for his error during the interview. Two clean sheets followed that night in Germany and it seemed like he'd turned a corner.
But an awful performance in the Champions League against Galatasaray, in which he gifted the opposition a penalty and went down far too easily for the matchwinner, followed.
There was redemption against Copenhagen, with Onana saving a 97th-minute penalty to seal a 1-0 victory, but United finished bottom of their group with just four points.
Onana was partly to blame for the club's worst performance in the Champions League group stage.

He began to improve in the winter, demonstrating impressive resilience to deliver strong displays in the Premier League. He notably kept a clean sheet in an ugly 0-0 draw against Liverpool at Anfield in December 2023, becoming the first goalkeeper to do so that season. He ended his first season strongly and started 2024/2025 in the same vein of form.

Onana won the Premier League's save of the month award for his double stop against Crystal Palace in September 2024 and somehow bettered it against Fenerbahce in October. Then it all started to go downhill for when United lost 2-0 against Arsenal in December.
The Cameroon international conceded two goals from corners, which was followed by a mistake against Nottingham Forest and another error against Viktoria Plzen in the Europa League.

Then the Lyon debacle happened in April. Nemanja Matic said Onana was "statistically one of the worst goalkeepers in Man United modern history" before the first leg, and Onana was subsequently at fault for both goals.
United pulled off a special victory against Lyon in the reverse match at Old Trafford and Onana sprinted to embrace Ruben Amorim on the touchline when Maguire got him out of jail.
But fans lost patience with Onana last season and will be relieved to see him leave on loan.
Erratic is probably the perfect word to describe Onana. He is not a goalkeeper who can be relied upon and can make embarrassing howlers at unexpected moments during matches.
United allowed David de Gea to leave upon the expiry of his contract in the summer of 2023 because his mistakes had become too regular and some performances were indefensible.

Onana has made a similar number of errors at United without having the previous credit that De Gea had banked. It was still the correct decision to allow De Gea to leave because United needed to sign a modern goalkeeper, but it's impossible to reject the suggestion that the succession was botched.
Onana prepared for this season under the assumption he would remain at Old Trafford, but Amorim has axed him from his plans and a joint decision was made to send him on loan.

Altay Bayindir has begun the campaign as first choice between the sticks. Onana was recalled to face Grimsby in the Carabao Cup and made a mistake for their second goal, which means he has made a shocking nine errors leading to a goal since the beginning of last season.

Sources close to the player have noted he will receive a pay rise in Turkey, partly due to the low tax rate for Super Lig players and the signing-on fee he will receive. They are clutching at straws to try to find positives.
Onana has suffered a spectacular fall from grace. He started in a Champions League final in June 2023, but will now play for a club that is not even considered among Turkey's traditional powerhouses.
The failure to cut out mistakes has cost Onana his career in Manchester.

headline: RAILSTON: Onana United transfer exit close as wage agreement clear
body: Turkish club Trabzonspor are set to cover Andre Onana's entire wages during his season-long loan.
Onana prepared for the new season under the assumption he would stay at Manchester United, but he was demoted when he returned from a hamstring injury and Senne Lammens was signed on deadline day.
The 29-year-old is set to complete a loan move to Trabzonspor once he returns from international duty with Cameroon, who play Cape Verde in a World Cup qualifier on Tuesday night.
Trabzonspor have agreed to pay Onana's entire wages during his loan spell. The goalkeeper will also receive a pay rise due to Turkey's 20 per cent tax rate for players in the Super Lig.
Onana was omitted from the United squad to face Arsenal, despite having three training sessions under his belt.
He was then named on the bench for Premier League games against Fulham and Burnley. He did face Grimsby Town in the Carabao Cup and was at fault for their second goal.
United completed the £18.2million (plus add-ons) signing of Lammens from Royal Antwerp on the final day of the summer window, which pushed Onana further down the pecking order.
On deadline day, club sources were unable to clarify how Lammens' arrival would impact the goalkeeper hierarchy, but a decision has now been made to ship out Onana to Turkey.

Onana made high-profile mistakes against Nottingham Forest, Viktoria Plzen and Lyon last season, and he clashed with Nemanja Matic on the eve of facing Lyon in the Europa League quarter-final first leg.
Matic said Onana is "one of the worst goalkeepers in Manchester United history" at a press conference. The midfielder added Onana needed to "take care" of what he had been talking about.
Onana responded on social media, writing: "I would never be disrespectful to another club. We know that tomorrow will be a difficult game against a strong opponent.
"We focus on preparing a performance to make our fans proud. At least I’ve lifted trophies with the greatest club in the world. Some can’t say the same."
The Turkish transfer window does not close until Friday, September 12.

headline: Christian Eriksen's next club after Man United transfer exit confirmed - 'I'm convinced'
body: Former Manchester United midfielder Christian Eriksen has completed his move to Bundesliga club Wolfsburg after being released by the Reds at the end of last season.

The Dane made over 100 appearances for United after leaving Brentford on a free transfer in 2022. After three years at the club, the decision was made to allow Eriksen to leave Old Trafford at the expiry of his contract.

Eriksen was offered the chance to sign for Hollywood-owned Wrexham in the Championship but turned the opportunity down. Recently, he has been training at Swedish club Malmo to keep his fitness levels high.

However, with the summer window now shut, the 33-year-old has managed to put pen to paper in Germany. Discussing his move to Wolfsburg, the Dane said: "VfL Wolfsburg is my first club in the Bundesliga – I’m really looking forward to this new adventure.
"I’m convinced we can achieve something together at Wolfsburg. The talks with the club bosses went very well.
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games this season, an increase of up to 100 more.

"I immediately sensed that Paul Simonis has a clear vision for the team and for me personally. The fact that there are several familiar faces in the squad from the Danish national team makes VfL a particularly attractive proposition for me."

Having acquired the signature of Eriksen, Wolfsburg's sporting director Sebastian Schindzielorz explained what drew the club to completing the deal. "We’re really pleased that this opportunity has arisen for us at short notice," he said.

"In Christian Eriksen, we’re getting a player who has seen and experienced everything at the highest level. His enormous experience, his quality on the pitch and his personality will be a valuable boost to our young players in particular.
"We’ve deliberately made structural changes this summer and signed several talented youngsters with great potential. Christian will complement our experienced captain, Max Arnold, perfectly.
"He’s a true leader who can make a difference on and off the pitch." Eriksen could make his debut for his new club on Saturday when they host Koln in the Bundesliga.

headline: Rasmus Hojlund responds to Man United star Ayden Heaven's cryptic update
body: Manchester United loanee Rasmus Hojlund has sent his support to Ayden Heaven after the centre-back shared a cryptic post of boxing legend Mike Tyson.

Heaven has found game time hard to come by so far this season having only made a three minute cameo in the Premier League away at Fulham. When the Englishman joined in January, he was thrust straight into the spotlight of the first-team as injuries forced Ruben Amorim into playing the teenager.

The former Arsenal man is still a firm member of the first-team squad but could lose his place on the bench once Lisandro Martinez returns from injury. With Harry Maguire and Luke Shaw's long-term futures most likely away from United, this may well be just a temporary setback for the promising defender.

During the September international break, Heaven was called up to the England U20s squad which hosted Italy at Chesterfield's SMH Group Stadium. The defender played 65 minutes in North Derbyshire before being replaced in the 2-1 friendly defeat.
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games this season, an increase of up to 100 more.

Now back with United at Carrington, the 18-year-old shared a few images from his time with the England set-up before ending the post with an image of Tyson sitting in his dressing room with his trainer Cus D'Amato watching over him. The reason behind including Tyson in the post is unclear but a number of United players responded to the post.

Captain Bruno Fernandes, Matthijs de Ligt, Patrick Dorgu and Leny Yoro were among the United players to 'like' the post while Hojlund simply replied: "Cool," in the comments section. The striker is currently on loan at Napoli after agreeing a summer transfer deadline day exit to the Italian club.

After Benjamin Sesko was bought from RB Leipzig, it became clear that Hojlund's game time was going to become seriously impacted. Once Italian clubs started to show interest, the Dane leaned towards Napoli as they offered him long-term certainty.

Hojlund has joined Napoli on loan but will make his switch permanent for £38m should certain conditions be met this season. As for Heaven, he will be hopeful of a place in the United squad on Sunday when they travel to Manchester City.

headline: Man United blocked from repeating Matheus Cunha transfer trick next year
body: Manchester United agreed to sign Matheus Cunha from Wolverhampton Wanderers one day after their season ended this summer.

Less than 24 hours after they concluded their post-season tour in Hong Kong, the club confirmed they had agreed to the signing, subject to visa and registration. United confirmed the transfer 11 days later on June 12, after Cunha signed a contract.

That was the first time they signed a player in June for six years, dating back to Daniel James joining the club from Swansea City. United, though, will not be able to make moves at such an early stage of next summer.
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games this season, an increase of up to 100 more.

Neither will any other clubs, because the summer window will not open until June 15. This year, the window began on June 1, the day United announced their agreement to sign Cunha, but that was an earlier date than usual due to the Club World Cup kicking off on June 14.

As such, FIFA allowed for an extraordinary transfer window to run between June 1-10 before reopening on June 16. But with no Club World Cup this coming summer - the next edition is scheduled for 2029 - normal service will resume.
The window will instead start during the early days of the World Cup across Canada, Mexico and the United States on June 15. Clubs, however, can still agree on signings before the market begins.

It means that, in 2026, United will not be permitted to conduct activity as early as they did to sign Cunha. Instead they will be required to wait until the transfer window opens at a more regular time on June 15.
Manchester United have unveiled their new third kit for the 2025/26 season.

United director of football Jason Wilcox expressed the club's delight at being able to recruit Cunha so quickly this summer. "Bringing in Matheus was one of our main priorities for this summer, so we are delighted to have completed his signing so early in the window," he said.

The player also alluded to the advantage of signing before the players returned for training. "I can't wait for the start of pre-season to get to know my team-mates and prepare for the season ahead," he said.

headline: Bryan Mbeumo takes Carlos Baleba action as Man United get glimpse at what might have been
body: Manchester United forward Bryan Mbeumo was seen consoling Carlos Baleba after the pair were on the receiving end of a shock result in the international break.

The £71m signing and the Brighton and Hove Albion midfielder were representing Cameroon in the African World Cup qualification matches. The Indomitable Lions were heavy favourites against Cape Verde, who have never qualified for the competition in their football history.

However, Dailon Livramento's second half goal saw the tiny African nation, which is located in the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of West Africa, secure a shock 1-0 victory. Cameroon were left shell-shocked after the match, which has thrown a spanner in their hopes of qualifying for the competition in the USA, Mexico and Canada.
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games this season, an increase of up to 100 more.

The crowd at the Estadio Nacional de Cabo Verde was so stunned by the victory - which leaves them on the verge of guaranteeing automatic qualification for the 2026 competition - that a huge pitch invasion took place.
Fortunately for Mbeumo, he had been substituted before the final whistle, which gave him an opportunity to seek out Baleba before the thousands of Cape Verdeans came onto the pitch.

Mbeumo actions towards the United transfer target suggests he could be key if the club act on their interest in Baleba and attempt to bring him to Old Trafford. Ruben Amorim's side were linked with a move for the Seagulls midfielder, but did not put forward an official bid for his services.
As Mbeumo was trying to calm Baleba, Hojlund offered Amorim a glimpse of what might have been. The Dane fell out of favour at United and left the club.

Hojlund, 22, secured a loan move to Napoli, which will become a £38m permanent move if the defending Serie A winners qualify for the Champions League. During his time with Denmark, the £72m signing from Atalanta scored in his nation's 3-0 away victory over Greece.

It was a significant goal from a United perspective, as Hojlund's goal came courtesy of an assist from Patrick Dorgu. With the latter often being one of the furthest players forward as a result of Amorim encouraging his wing-backs to attack, the United boss' first ever signing assisting Hojlund might have been a regular sight at Old Trafford had things gone differently.

Despite his disappointment at being shipped out of United, Italian outlet Tuttomercatoweb claimed Hojlund was seen training with his new Napoli team-mates, less than 24 hours after returning from international duty. It's a clear sign he will be doing everything he can to prove United wrong.

He said: "It’s different now, obviously, as I come with more experience and I’m a better football player. I come with a lot of international experience, I played in the Premier League, Champions League, Europa League, and in multiple countries. I come with a lot to prove.

"I want to show myself in the best team in Italy, and Napoli is going to be very, very good. I always work hard, I like to say I want to die on the pitch, to give everything for the team, to score goals, create, and fight for everything.”

headline: Wayne Rooney's son Kai shares heartbreaking update - 'Life can't get worse'
body: Wayne Rooney's 15-year-old son Kai has declared 'life can't get worse' following a devastating injury for the Manchester United's youth player.
The 35-year-old Rooney, who claimed countless honours at Old Trafford, harbours hopes that his eldest child might emulate his remarkable career.
But Kai has picked up an injury, reports the Mirror. Prior to this setback, Kai had been experiencing a meteoric rise through the ranks at his father's former club.
He had recently earned promotion to the United Under-19s squad, where he was competing alongside players four years his senior.
The call-up was followed with a spectacular strike for the Under-18s, as he unleashed a left-footed volley that nestled in the top corner.
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games this season, an increase of up to 100 more.
But any upward trajectory he had built must now be rebuilt during an enforced spell away from action. Kai shared a mirror selfie displaying the protective boot encasing his right foot.
Accompanying the image, he said: "Life can't get worse" complete with a weeping emoji.
The exact nature of his injury or the duration of his absence remains uncertain.
Nevertheless, the sentiment expressed in his social media post hints it could be considerable time before he wears a United shirt again.
Whilst he has yet to capture public attention in the manner of his legendary father, he has significant potential.
The youngster usually plays in a central position for United, mirroring Rooney Sr's role, but has also shown his versatility by performing well in wider areas.
His standout performance came during the Super Cup NI in Northern Ireland earlier this summer, a tournament in which his father also shone as a budding talent at Everton.
Wayne, alongside wife Coleen and their youngest sons Kit and Cass, was seen cheering on Kai from the sidelines.

When asked about the influence he has had on his son's burgeoning football career, the former England captain revealed that he prefers to let Kai find his own way in the game rather than inundating him with advice.

In an interview with BBC Sport, Rooney said: "I just let him play. I think they started the competition well, they won 3-0, he scored the penalty and got an assist. So I think he started OK. He just plays and that's all he's done during his time playing.

"I think it's very unfair for anyone to expect him to go and do all kinds. He's just playing, he's a 15-year-old boy playing his football, enjoying it. Of course he gets different attention to a lot of his team-mates but I think he handles that really well."

Rooney also praised the coaching staff at United, stating: "He has great coaches at Manchester United, so I take a stand off approach. I speak to him, but for me it's all about his mentality and his mindset, to make sure he keeps enjoying it - that's the main thing for me."
Kai has been a part of the United academy since he was 11 years old. He joined the youth system in 2020.

headline: Man United must address worrying transfer concern as Rasmus Hojlund primed to repeat trend
body: Manchester United's recruitment in recent years can best be described as embarrassing.

The fact that you can count on one hand, potentially two if you are feeling generous, the number of new signings that have made a lasting and respectable impact on this squad in the last few seasons says all you need to know about the problems which Ruben Amorim is trying to fix. Too many United players have crumbled under the pressure of attempting to put this club back on its pedestal.
Not all can be blamed. Many had little to no experience of playing for a club of this magnitude and struggled to handle the weight of expectation which comes with such a shirt.

However, a new worrying trend which is starting to rear its head in recent times is players that leave United suddenly manage to discover some of their best form - perhaps of their career to date - away from Old Trafford. Take last season as an example for the theory.

Scott McTominay at Napoli and Antony at Real Betis respectively, performed sensationally for their new clubs. While there is an argument to suggest that McTominay had shown signs of this incredible up turn before leaving, Antony looked far from the player he has become in Spain.
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games this season, an increase of up to 100 more.

The Brazilian flourished in La Liga and it is not simply a case that he is playing against lesser opposition now, he simply appears to be more confident on the pitch than he ever was at United. Now, Rasmus Hojlund appears primed to show the Reds exactly what they are missing in Italy.

The Dane appears to be a man on a mission after scoring against Greece in World Cup qualifying this week. Less than 24 hours after that goal, the 22-year-old flew to Napoli to begin training with his new teammates.

Hojlund will undoubtedly feel confident that he can perform in Serie A having done so for Atalanta previously but if he does, United must address why this keeps happening. Is the club fostering an environment which is detrimental to player performance?

Are the coaches struggling to handle the rigours of the Premier League and this is being passed on to the players? Or, are United simply giving opportunities to players who would be better served at clubs lower down the pyramid?

There needs to be a serious discussion surrounding this at United. It is no good just looking on and scratching their heads wondering how another player has shown their true potential at another club.

I refuse to believe that United have consistently signed players that are not good enough to play for a club of this stature. There has to be a deeper reasoning behind it and until that has been figured out, United cannot expect to make the major steps to return themselves to the very top.

headline: Manchester United could add two players to their strongest squad ahead of Man City clash
body: Manchester United return to Premier League action this Sunday aware that the stakes of this Manchester derby could not be higher for the two clubs contesting it.

Both Manchester City and United have endured mixed starts to the season and they are both in desperate need of a big, positive result to lift their campaign. Arguably, the Reds have marginally less pressure on themselves than Pep Guardiola's men.

United sit above City in the table and they know that a draw, while not the triumphant bragging rights that supporters crave, would be a positive result away from home. However, there is every reason for Reds fans to feel confident they can pick up all three points.

City find themselves with an injury crisis heading into the fixture and United know that if Matheus Cunha, Mason Mount and Diogo Dalot's injuries have cleared up, they shall be able to field Ruben Amorim's first choice team this weekend. What's more, United have two players who could be added to their strongest squad as soon as Sunday to boost their chances further.
Defence may be one of the strongest areas of the pitch for United. The Reds are starting to look more comfortable in the three at the back system with their centre halves suiting Amorim's vision.
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games this season, an increase of up to 100 more.

But add to that selection dilemma Lisandro Martinez and suddenly it looks even stronger still. The Argentine has been out of action since February and there are no definite signs that he will be fit to make the squad against City.

However, he has been back on the grass at Carrington and the hope is that he will not be too far off a return to the matchday squad. Were he be available for the derby, he would likely be among the substitutes at the Etihad Stadium taking Ayden Heaven's place in the squad.

While potentially harsh on Heaven, Martinez has proven time and again that he gets United and has the right mentality to represent the club. Just having his voice back in the dressing room would be a huge lift for the club and undoubtedly make United stronger.
From one area that has been coping well to another which hasn't - the goalkeeping department. Andre Onana is set to depart for Trabzonspor meaning his place will need to be taken in the squad.

Fortunately, Senne Lammens was signed to replace the Cameroonian and it will be interesting to see if he is thrown in at the deep end or not on Sunday. Altay Bayindir has been the first choice in the Premier League this season but he has already made mistakes that have questioned his entitlement to start.
Will Lammens be given the nod to start? Time will tell but the Belgian could well be handed a place in his first matchday squad at United for the game, even if he starts on the bench.

headline: Manchester United summer transfer window verdict speaks volumes
body: Manchester United's transfer business has been given the seal of approval by supporters.
Ruben Amorim's side concluded a deal for Senne Lammens on deadline day to supplement moves for attacking pair Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo and teenage prospect Diego Leon.

United also managed to move out the majority of their unwanted senior stars, with Marcus Rashford and Jadon Sancho securing loan moves to Barcelona and Aston Villa, respectively, while Antony joined Real Betis and Alejandro Garnacho departed for Chelsea.
Tyrell Malacia does remain at Old Trafford, but he could still depart with the transfer windows in Turkey and Saudi Arabia remaining open.
Those destinations could also offer a route out for goalkeeper Andre Onana, who is reportedly weighing up a loan switch to Trabzonspor.
Amorim's side have taken four points from their opening three Premier League games while suffering a shock exit to League Two side Grimsby Town in the EFL Cup.
But despite that stuttering start to the campaign, United supporters believe the recruitment bodes well.
More than 6,000 fans responded to our survey asking fans to deliver their verdict on the window and the majority were positive.
Indeed, 54 per cent summed the window up as good, and seven per cent thought it was excellent.
Only three per cent summed it up as terrible, with 10 per cent labelling it disappointing and the remaining 26 per cent viewing it as average.
United will now hope to deliver an improved season on the pitch.

headline: Matheus Cunha provides 'Sunday' Manchester United injury hint ahead of Man City clash
body: Manchester United forward Matheus Cunha has suggested that his recovery from injury is progressing well and hinted that he could be fit for Sunday's trip to Manchester City in the Premier League.

United fans were left holding their collective breaths before the international break when the Brazilian was forced off the pitch in the victory over Burnley. It appeared at the time that Cunha had suffered a hamstring injury, although that was not confirmed.

Further worry was created when Cunha pulled out of the Brazil national team squad for the September international break, leading many to wonder whether he would recover in time for the clash against City. Fortunately, during the break, Cunha has remained in good spirits and has hit the gym hard to recuperate.

On Sunday, Cunha took to Instagram to share a series of images from his gym session with his latest one that evening perhaps hinting that he could return this weekend. Pictured in good spirits, the 26-year-old captioned the post: "Sunday's," with a smirking smile emoji.
The meaning behind the post is, of course, up for interpretation. On the one hand, it may simply be a caption relating to the day of the week he was training.

However, the emoji could lead to the interpretation that he is nearing full fitness again and that 'Sunday's' fixture against City will be his return to the field. If that is the case, it would be a welcome relief for Ruben Amorim.

Cunha has been a mainstay in the strikeforce so far this season and Amorim will be hopeful of having the strongest team available to him for the fixture at the Etihad Stadium. In recent years, United have entered the derby as underdogs but could have grounds to argue that they are favourites this time round as they sit above their neighbours at this admittedly early stage of the campaign.
As well as Cunha, Amorim shall also be awaiting promising news on Mason Mount, Diogo Dalot and Lisandro Martinez's conditions ahead of the fixture.

headline: Three transfers Manchester United could complete in next five days
body: Manchester United may have wrapped up all their incomings for the summer transfer window, but some players could still be sold in the coming days.

United added goalkeeper Senne Lammens on deadline day, with the Belgian adding to the attacking arrivals of Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo, plus youngster Diego Leon, as Ruben Amorim reshaped his squad ahead of the September 1 deadline.

And while Premier League clubs are not able to get any more new faces through the door after the window shut earlier this week, there remain opportunities to sell any unwanted stars to clubs whose domestic windows remain open. And United could capitalise on the chance to do just that.
The window in Turkey remains open until September 12, with Andre Onana linked with a loan switch to Trabzonspor, with the 29-year-old reportedly weighing up the switch.
The Cameroon international has yet to start a league game and the arrival of Lammens has added a further layer of competition in the United goalkeeping department.

It's not just Onana who is under pressure, with Altay Bayindir also coming in for criticism in the opening weeks of the campaign. He has started all three Premier League matches but made errors against Arsenal and Burnley and has yet to fully convince.
While United are unlikely to let both goalkeepers depart, Turkey international Bayindir has also been linked with a move to his homeland this summer.
Meanwhile, unwanted defender Tyrell Malacia remains at Old Trafford after his loan move to Spanish side Elche collapsed late in the window.
The 26-year-old is another who could seal a United exit in the coming days, with a switch to Turkey a possibility.
The window in Saudi Arabia has plenty of days left to run, closing on September 23.

Several Premier League teams have capitalised on the willingness by Saudi Pro League clubs to spend big on talent in recent years. Darwin Nunez was the highest-profile player to leave an English club for Saudi this summer.
United defender Harry Maguire is reportedly wanted by clubs in the Saudi Pro League, but any exit for the England international in the coming weeks seems unlikely.
Other windows still open include Greece (September 12) and Serbia (September 17).

headline: RAILSTON: Manchester United to play behind-closed-doors friendly vs Aston Villa
body: Manchester United's Under-21s will play Aston Villa in a friendly at Bodymoor Heath.
The U21s claimed an impressive victory against Manchester City in the Premier League 2 last weekend, but there is a small gap until their next competitive fixture against Brackley.

United have been keen to fill that space and organised a friendly against a PFA XI (senior players who are free agents) on Wednesday. The U21s drew 1-1 thanks to a wonderful Shea Lacey goal before half-time.
The U21s will next be in action against Aston Villa in a behind-closed-doors friendly away from home at Bodymoor Heath next Friday.

The Premier League 2 recently changed its format and the U21s will not play Villa in a league fixture this season, so the friendly will be a chance for both sides to clash during the international break.
Travis Binnion's side have made a dream start to the league campaign, winning all three of their games, but Villa have won against West Brom and lost against Leeds and Chelsea.
The friendlies will sharpen fitness ahead of the next competitive game against Brackley on September 16.
Lacey was the standout performer against the PFA. The youngster made his first appearance of the season in the Manchester derby victory and was heaped with praise by Binnion.

"Listen, everybody in the world knows about Shea Lacey," said Binnion. "So he needs a little bit of fortune, he needs to be patient with himself and everybody else needs to be really patient with him.

"He is in the same sort of area as Chido because of time lost. Different to Chido, Chido is fast progression. Because of time lost with Shea, he still has lots to come tactically, physically and mentally.

"Everybody can see - you have to be blind not to see - the talent he's got. He's got lots to do in his game and he knows. We're still managing him physically because if he can stay on the pitch and can train every day, I think everyone thinks he could be a top, top player."

headline: Manchester United opponents rocked by positive doping test as UEFA release statement
body: An Athletic Club player who faced Manchester United in the Europa League semi-final last season failed a doping test after the clash against Ruben Amorim's side.

Yeray Alvarez, 30, started at centre-back for the La Liga heavyweights when United overcame them 3-0 in the first leg at San Mames. After the match, he was selected for a random drug test by officials at the stadium.

Just over four months later, UEFA have released a statement revealing the defender tested positive for a banned substance and has since "accepted a voluntary provisional suspension, having effect from that date." The Spaniard has since claimed the substance within his body has come from a treatment he used to combat alopecia.
In their statement, UEFA wrote: "On 1 May 2025, Athletic Club player Yeray Alvarez underwent an in-competition doping control carried out by UEFA following a UEFA Europa League match.

"The analysis of the player's sample by a WADA-accredited laboratory revealed the presence of Canrenone, which is a substance prohibited in- (and out-) of competition under the category S5. Diuretics and Masking Agents of the 2025 WADA Prohibited List.

"On 2 June 2025, the player accepted a voluntary provisional suspension having effect from that date. Following the opening of disciplinary proceedings against the player - on 10 June 2025 - two UEFA Ethics and Disciplinary Inspectors conducted an investigation and the case was submitted to the UEFA disciplinary bodies for decision.
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games this season, an increase of up to 100 more.

"At its meeting on 19 August 2025, the relevant UEFA disciplinary body decided to suspend the player for 10 months, starting from the date of the provisional suspension (i.e. 2 June 2025) and ending on 2 April 2026, for committing a non-intentional anti-doping rule violation.

"In accordance with Article 10.14.2 of the UEFA Anti-Doping Regulations, the player may return to train with a team or use the facilities of a club in the last two months of his period of ineligibility, i.e. as of 2 February 2026."

Speaking on his social media page, Alvarez wrote: "After studying the case, we have established that I tested positive because I unintentionally took a hair loss prevention medicine containing a banned substance.

"The disciplinary procedure is currently under investigation and subject to confidentiality - so I am provisionally suspended - and am not authorised to make any further public statements. I very much regret this situation but, with the support of the club, I am working on my defence in the belief that I will be able to return to the field of play as soon as possible."

United comfortably overcame Athletic Club with goals from Casemiro and a first-half double from captain Bruno Fernandes. Amorim's side then followed up the away victory with a 4-1 triumph at Old Trafford, which saw Mason Mount score a brace and Casemiro and Rasmus Hojlund get on the score-sheet.

Alvarez has been at Athletic Club throughout his whole career, making 325 appearances for the Basque club. He played a huge role in his club's Copa Del Rey triumph in the 2023/24 campaign, the only major trophy he has won with his childhood club, so far.
He will be unavailable for the majority of the campaign as a result of the failed test.

headline: Paul Pogba, Ravel Morrison, Jesse Lingard - Where are Manchester United 2011 Youth Cup winners now?
body: Paul Pogba and Ravel Morrison led Manchester United to FA Youth Cup victory in 2011.
The Youth Cup is the most prestigious competition in academy football and United have won it more than any other club. They last lifted the trophy at Old Trafford in 2021/22.
Alejandro Garnacho and Kobbie Mainoo helped to end a 10-year wait at United for more success in the competition, following a triumph from a supremely talented team in 2011.
The Class of 2011 was considered to have so much promise, they were dubbed the next ‘Class of 92’.
So where are the players now? We've taken a closer look at their respective career paths.

The 32-year-old only completed a permanent move out of United in 2018 to join West Brom for around £6m. The goalkeeper had previously worked his way up the Football League during loan spells at Oldham, Scunthorpe, Walsall, Yeovil, Doncaster, Preston and Aston Villa.

Johnstone had joined United in July 2009 and quickly became first choice for United’s youth team. The 6ft 4ins shot-stopper made over 150 appearances for West Brom before signing for Crystal Palace in 2022.
He is now the second choice goalkeeper at Wolves and has won four caps for England.

Keane had been at United since the age of 11, until he finally left to join Burnley in 2015 after a successful loan spell at Turf Moor. Keane's two years playing under Sean Dyche earned him plenty of attention and he joined Everton in 2017 for a fee that could rise to £30m.
The centre-back is still an important player at Everton and has 12 England caps to his name.
An Italian centre-half, Fornasier joined the United set up in 2009 from Fiorentina.
Although he helped United lift the 2011 FA Youth Cup and appeared in the Under-21 Squad, he failed to make a first team appearance and headed back to Italy in 2013.
Spells at Sampdoria, Pescara, Venezia, Parma, Trapani, Cremonese and Monopoli followed. Fornasier currently plays for Nardo in Serie D.
A powerhouse of a defender, there were high hopes for Sean McGinty at United.

Unfortunately, these failed to materialise and McGinty was sent out on loan to Morecambe, Oxford United, Carlisle United and Tranmere before finally leaving in 2013 to Sheffield United in search of first-team football.
McGinty has subsequently played for Rochdale, Aldershot, Torquay United, Partick Thistle, Greenock Morton, Ayr United, Hamilton Academical and Airdrieonians.

Another defender straight from the United academy who sadly couldn’t make the grade at Old Trafford. Although appearing for England at all youth levels, Thorpe struggled for appearances at Rotherham United, where he joined after leaving United permanently in 2015.
After spells at Bradford, Bolton and ATK of the Indian Premier League, Thorpe had a break from professional football. He last played for Greater Manchester club Stalybridge Celtic in 2024.

After making his United senior debut in a cup game against Newcastle in 2012, Tunnicliffe famously won his father £10,000 after he bet £100 at 100/1 that his son, aged nine at the time, would make a first-team appearance for the Reds.

Sadly, it did not progress much beyond that for the Bury-born midfielder and he left the club in 2014 to join Fulham, signed by former United coach Rene Meulensteen. Tunnicliffe went on to make 59 appearances, scoring twice for the Cottagers.
Loans at Wigan and Blackburn came next, followed by a free transfer to Millwall in 2017. Tunnicliffe then played for Luton and Portsmouth before signing for Australian club Adelaide.
Where to start with Paul Pogba?
He became United's record signing after leaving United for Juventus in 2012 under acrimonious circumstances before re-signing in 2016 for £89m.

Pogba had been promoted to the first team by Sir Alex Ferguson for a FA Cup game against Crawley Town in 2011, however, first-team opportunities would later be hard to come by, with Paul Scholes and Michael Carrick ahead him.
He would make three first-team appearances in the Premier League and Europa League before his free transfer to Juve.
Pogba's second stint in Manchester did not hit the heights that were expected, although he did win the League Cup and Europa League during his six-year stay.

He returned to Juventus in 2022, but he was suspended in September 2023 due to the failure of a drug test. Pogba's contract was ended by mutual consent at the end of last year and he made his return to football with Monaco this summer.

Lingard joined United at the age of seven and as a reward for winning the FA Youth Cup, he was handed his first professional contract in the summer of 2011. He was soon sent out on loan, and Leicester City was the chosen destination, with Lingard going on to make his competitive debut at The Foxes.
Lingard was again sent out on loan in 2013 by David Moyes to Birmingham and Brighton, while finally managing to break through to the first team in 2014.
He famously scored the winning goal in the 2016 FA Cup final and he also scored the opening goal in United’s 2016 FA Community Shield win, while also netting in the 2017 League Cup Final.

The forward hit his peak in 2018 where an impressive season for United was followed by his key role in England's fourth-placed finish at the 2018 World Cup. Lingard was excellent during a loan with West Ham in 2020/21, but he remained at United for another season and left permanently for Nottingham Forest in 2022.
Lingard has been playing for South Korean K League club FC Seoul since his surprise move in February 2024.

Arguably the key man in the Class of 2011, Morrison overshadowed fellow teammates Pogba and Lingard with his pace, flair and vision. United legend Gary Neville described Morrison as 'a Paul Gascoigne-type who could beat men and score some incredible goals'.

But off-field issues undermined his talent and United reluctantly let Morrison go. In 2012, he joined then Championship side West Ham and after spells at QPR, Cardiff, Lazio, Club Atlas and Ostersunds, Morrison returned to England with Sheffield United in 2019.
Morrison only made four appearances for the Blades. He joined Dutch club ADO Den Haag and later signed for Derby County, which was followed by a move to reunite with Wayne Rooney at D.C. United.
The 32-year-old midfielder currently plays for Precision FC in Dubai.

After starting his footballing career at Ajax, Van Velzen became one of the youngest players in the FA Youth Cup winning team after joining in 2010. The tricky forward signed a professional contract in 2012 and was sent out on loan to Royal Antwerp in Belgium.

He returned a few months later but by the summer of 2013 the decision was made to release Van Velzen from his contract. Van Velzen returned to the Netherlands and played for FC Utrecht, FC Volendam and Roda JC in the Eredivisie before a return to England in the summer of 2019.
Van Velzen signed for League Two side Crawley, but he only made five appearances for the club and he went back to the Netherlands, where he still plays for VVSB.
The lanky forward was United’s target man, becoming top scorer for the youth team with 16 goals including eight in their FA Youth Cup winning campaign.
Keane made his first-team debut in late 2011, coming on in a defeat to Blackburn Rovers, but a knee ligament problem ruled him out of the entire 2012/2013 season.

With a few unsuccessful loan spells away from United, Keane eventually left to join former Reds assistant manager Mike Phelan at Hull City in 2016. It took him two years to score his first goal for the club, coming in a 5-0 away win to Burton Albion in April 2018.
Keane currently plays for Preston North End after stints with Ipswich Town and Wigan.
Blackett left United permanently in 2016 after a loan spells at Blackpool, Birmingham and Celtic.
He made over 100 appearances for Reading before representing Nottingham Forest, FC Cincinnati and Rotherham, but Blackett has been without a club as a free agent for over a year now.
Cole joined Fulham along with Tunnicliffe in 2014. He currently plays for Warrington Town.
Coll joined Derry City after being released from United, but his spell there only lasted half a season and he stopped playing professional football.
Cofie worked his way around the lower reaches of the Football League and non-league circuit, adding 12 clubs to his name after leaving United. He entered coaching at the age of 27 in 2020.
Centre-back Massacci returned to Italy following his release from United in 2012. He dropped out of football after leaving ASD Valentino Mazzola in 2017.

headline: Manchester United's £7m signing now has a new target after 16-year wait ended
body: Manchester United have high hopes for summer signing Diego Leon.
The 18-year-old signed for United this summer from Paraguayan side Cerro Porteno in a deal that could rise as high as £7million.
He broke into their first team as a 17-year-old and has already made an impression at United, training exclusively with the first team since his arrival.
Leon featured throughout pre-season for United and impressed enough to be retained with the first team squad beyond the summer window.
Fellow teenage left-back Harry Amass, who made seven appearances for United last season was shipped off on loan to Championship side Sheffield Wednesday instead.
Certainly Ruben Amorim has been impressed. "He did really well, he's learning things, he's powerful," the United boss said of Leon back in July. "He's going to be a very good player."
It means Leon is back-up to Patrick Dorgu and the challenge now facing the talented teenager is getting into the United side.
He made his debut for the under-21s in their friendly against the PFA free agents' XI in midweek and will likely feature for them more regularly while he waits for his chance in the first team.
But the hype around his potential in Paraguay is huge. Cerro Porteno chairman Juan Jose Zapag described him as 'a left-back like no other in the world, the kind that's rare to find'.
And his motivation now will be to try and force his way into his country's thinking ahead of the 2026 World Cup.
La Albirroja's 0-0 draw with Ecuador was enough to secure their place in the World Cup for the first time in 16 years and that led the country's president, Santiago Pena, to declare a public holiday.

Leon has been capped at under-20 level but if he can force his way into the United side this season, he will fancy his chances of having a late run at being included in the squad for next year's showpiece in the USA, Canada and Mexico.
Junior Alonso of Atletico Mineiro and Agustin Sandez of Rosario Central are the two men standing in his way but if he needed extra motivation to succeed at United then he has just found it.
